title: dms-exchange-specification (dxs) metadata description
description: This schema defines the metadata for a single document as specified by the dms-exchange-specification.

createdTime.description: Timestamp when the container was created/exported.

createdBy.description: User who has triggered the export.

source.description: Information about the system that has created the export.

name.description: Name of the system that has created the export.

version.description: Version of the system that has created the export.

url.description: Website from the vendor of the system that has created the export.

email.description: Email to contact the vendor of the system that has created the export.

documentFiles.description: Groups the document-files in the given order that form a document.

filename.description: Name of the indexed document-file inside the container.

rotation.description: Degree the document-file has to rotate clockwise to have a correct orientation.

addedBy.description: User who has added or changed the revision.

addedTime.description: Timestamp when the revision of the document-file has been added or changed.

context.description: Information taken from the document content and are inherent to it.

dueDateTime.description: A due date the document might have.

note.description: Free text field for document-notes, made by the users

location.description: Physical location of the scanned documents, if available

commentBy.description: User who has added a comment.

commentTime.description: Timestamp when the comment was added.

idUser.description: An id the user can define uniquely for the document

idSystem.description: An id the system has provided for the document

project.description: A project the document has been associated with.

directory.description: If the dms works hierarchically, this field contains the directory. It is written in *nix-style, starting from the root downwards, using slashes.

optionIndexed.description: Should the document be shown in the index (if using a search), or only when the user navigates to the document explicitly.

optionOcr.description: Should the document be analyzed or not.
